episodeTitle: Leftover Chivalry! The Traitorous Zombie who Protects Nami
episodeTitleJapanese: 残る騎士道！ナミを守る裏切りゾンビ
episodeTitleRomanized: Nokoru Kishidō! Nami o Mamoru Uragiri Zonbi
description: Inuppe, the zombie with Sanji's shadow, refuses to attack Nami and is struck down by Absalom. Meanwhile, Nami escapes another kidnapping attempt as Lola pursues her, while Franky and Robin battle Tararan and destroy a bridge to buy time. Brook suddenly falls from the sky.

events.title: Inuppe Refuses to Attack Nami
events.description: Inuppe, the zombie animated with Sanji's shadow, refuses to attack Nami despite orders from his allies. He demonstrates that Sanji's core chivalrous values remain intact even in the shadow, declaring he would rather die than harm a woman.
events.significance: This moment powerfully demonstrates that shadows contain not just memories but core personality traits and deeply held values. It shows the depth of Sanji's chivalry as an unbreakable principle.

quotes.text: I would rather die than harm a lady!
quotes.speaker: Inuppe
quotes.context: Inuppe refuses to attack Nami, showing Sanji's chivalrous nature

events.title: Absalom Strikes Down Inuppe
events.description: Angered by Inuppe's refusal to follow orders, Absalom uses his technique 'Shisha no Te' (Hand of the Dead) to strike down the traitorous zombie, blasting him into a wall.
events.significance: Shows Absalom's ruthless control over the zombie army and his willingness to destroy his own subordinates for disobedience.

events.title: Absalom Uses Shisha no Te
events.description: Absalom debuts his technique 'Shisha no Te' (Hand of the Dead), a powerful attack he uses to strike down Inuppe for his defiance.
events.significance: First appearance of one of Absalom's signature combat techniques, demonstrating his power as one of the Mysterious Four.

events.title: Nami Escapes from Absalom
events.description: Using the chaos caused by Inuppe's rebellion, Nami manages to escape from Absalom's clutches, narrowly avoiding another kidnapping attempt by the invisible zombie commander.
events.significance: Nami continues to evade Absalom's pursuit, showing her resourcefulness and determination to avoid the forced wedding ceremony.

events.title: Lola Pursues Nami
events.description: The zombie warthog Lola, wielding a large ornate axe, chases Nami out of the garden. Lola is obsessed with marrying Absalom and sees Nami as a rival for his affections.
events.significance: Introduces the comedic yet dangerous pursuit by Lola, adding another layer of threat to Nami's situation on Thriller Bark.

events.title: Lola Uses Chikai no Himesama Dakko
events.description: Lola debuts her technique 'Chikai no Himesama Dakko' (Oath Princess Carry), one of her Hanayome Bujutsu (Bride Martial Arts) techniques, as she pursues Nami.
events.significance: First appearance of Lola's unique fighting style that combines wedding-themed attacks with her zombie strength.

events.title: Franky and Robin Face Tararan
events.description: Franky and Nico Robin are confronted by Tararan, the giant spider-monkey General Zombie who commands the Spider Mice. They also face multiple General Zombies on a bridge.
events.significance: The Straw Hats encounter one of the powerful General Zombies, escalating the conflict on Thriller Bark.

events.title: Franky and Robin Destroy the Bridge
events.description: To buy time against Tararan and the General Zombies, Franky and Robin work together to destroy the bridge they are all standing on, creating distance from their pursuers.
events.significance: Demonstrates the tactical teamwork between Franky and Robin as they use their environment to gain an advantage against superior numbers.

events.title: Robin Uses Cien Fleur: Wing
events.description: Nico Robin debuts her technique 'Cien Fleur: Wing' (Hundred Flower: Wing), using her Hana Hana no Mi powers to sprout one hundred arms in the shape of wings, allowing her limited flight capability.
events.significance: First appearance of Robin's wing technique, significantly expanding her combat abilities and mobility. This technique becomes one of her signature moves.

quotes.speaker: Nico Robin
quotes.context: Robin debuts her wing technique to escape danger

events.title: Brook Falls from the Sky
events.description: In a dramatic and comedic moment, Brook suddenly falls from the sky, landing hard on the ground near Franky and Robin's location. This unexpected arrival sets up his reunion with the crew.
events.significance: Brook's dramatic entrance marks an important moment in his gradual integration with the Straw Hat crew during the Thriller Bark arc.

quotes.text: I would rather die than harm a lady!
quotes.speaker: Inuppe
quotes.context: Demonstrating Sanji's chivalry through his shadow

themes.description: The episode explores how deeply ingrained values persist even when separated from the body. Sanji's chivalry remains in his shadow, showing that core principles are fundamental to identity.
themes.symbolism: Inuppe's refusal to harm Nami symbolizes the unbreakable nature of true honor and chivalry.

themes.description: Franky and Robin demonstrate the importance of tactical thinking and teamwork when facing overwhelming odds, using their environment and abilities creatively.
themes.symbolism: The destroyed bridge represents creating your own path and using creativity to overcome obstacles.

themes.description: Nami's continued resistance against Absalom and the various threats on Thriller Bark shows her growth as a character and her refusal to be a victim.

characterSpotlights.development: Inuppe's refusal to harm Nami demonstrates that Sanji's chivalry is an integral part of his being, persisting even in his separated shadow.
keyActions: Refuses to attack Nami despite orders
Declares he would rather die than harm a lady
Gets struck down by Absalom for his defiance
quotes: I would rather die than harm a lady!

characterSpotlights.development: Nami continues to show her resourcefulness and determination as she evades multiple threats on Thriller Bark.
keyActions: Uses the chaos to her advantage

characterSpotlights.development: Robin debuts a major new technique that expands her combat capabilities, showing her continued growth as a fighter.
Franky demonstrates his tactical thinking and teamwork skills while facing the General Zombies.
keyActions: Fights against Tararan and General Zombies
Works with Robin to destroy the bridge

characterSpotlights.development: Absalom shows his ruthless nature and power as one of the Mysterious Four, while continuing his obsessive pursuit of Nami.
keyActions: Strikes down Inuppe with Shisha no Te

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime expands on the chase sequences and adds more dramatic moments with Lola pursuing Nami.
The anime adds more detail to the battle choreography between Franky, Robin, and Tararan.

trivia.fact: This episode demonstrates one of the core themes of the Thriller Bark arc: that shadows contain not just memories but fundamental personality traits and values.
Robin's Cien Fleur: Wing technique debuts in this episode and becomes one of her most iconic abilities, used frequently in later arcs.
Inuppe's character design as a penguin-bulldog hybrid with Sanji's shadow creates a humorous visual contrast that emphasizes the absurdity of the situation.
The episode aired in Japan on March 16, 2008, and was later released in the US on DVD on September 30, 2014, before airing on Toonami on May 21, 2016.
Tararan's name and design is a pun on 'tarantula' and 'spider monkey', combining both creatures into one zombie general.
